item.title: Microsoft open-sources 3D Movie Maker
item.description:
3D Movie Maker is a children's computer program published by Microsoft in 1995 under the Microsoft Home multimedia product line.

Today Microsoft released the 3D Movie Maker source code under the MIT license, 27 years since its original release.

item.title: EU joins the Fediverse
item.description: Yesterday the European Data Protection Supervisor (EDPS) announced the launch of the public pilot phase of two social media platforms: EU Voice and EU Video.

item.title: Winamp. It really SUCKS the llama's ass
item.description: Shame on you, Radionomy, for NOT releasing any new Winamp versions, NOT updating about Winamp itself and instead announcing just another NFT bullshit.

item.title: LimeWire comes back. But there's a problem
item.description:
Does anyone remember what LimeWire is?

LimeWire was a free software peer-to-peer file sharing (P2P) client. Since 2000, it was in great demand for a whole decade as a place for pirated music, films, documents and, of course, viruses (!!!).

item.title: Crosser Bot gets hacked
item.description: Today many Telegram channels posted the same political post about Russian invasion of Ukraine. It starts with the following words: "We will have to delete this message, and some of us will even be fired or imprisoned, but we cannot take it anymore".

item.title: Twitter is NO MORE in Russia!
item.description: Yesterday there were news that Roskomnadzor started blocking Twitter in Russia.

item.title: Hello, world!
item.description:
The new version of my website is now live!

Just to make sure that everything works correctly, have a doodle :-)))
